category_system.description: German profanity categorization considering compound words, regional variations, and cultural context
category_system.methodology: Based on German sociolinguistic research and cultural studies

general.name: Allgemeine Schimpfwörter
general.description: Common swear words and mild expletives without specific targeting
general.examples_note: Basic profanity used for emphasis or frustration

sexual.name: Sexuelle Inhalte
sexual.description: Words related to sexual acts, anatomy, or sexually explicit content

subcategories.prostitution: Terms related to sex work (hure, nutte)

hate_speech.name: Hassrede
hate_speech.description: Language targeting individuals or groups based on identity characteristics

slurs.name: Beschimpfungen und Beleidigungen
slurs.description: Derogatory terms targeting specific groups or individuals
slurs.examples_note: Offensive terms for groups and individuals

body_parts.name: Unangemessene Körperteile
body_parts.description: Crude or inappropriate references to body parts
body_parts.examples_note: Anatomical terms used inappropriately or crudely

scatological.name: Skatologisch
scatological.description: References to bodily waste and bathroom functions

violence.name: Gewalt und Aggression
violence.description: Words promoting or describing violence, threats, or aggressive behavior

subcategories.threats: Direct or implied threats of harm
subcategories.weapons: References to weapons in threatening context
subcategories.nazi_violence: References to Nazi ideology and violence

religious.name: Religiöse Profanität
religious.description: Blasphemous or sacrilegious language targeting religious beliefs

compound_profanity.name: Zusammengesetzte Schimpfwörter
compound_profanity.examples_note: Creative compound insults using German morphology

1.description: Generally acceptable in casual conversation but may be filtered in formal settings
1.cultural_notes: Often used casually, varies by region and generation

2.description: Inappropriate in most professional or public settings
2.cultural_notes: Context-dependent severity, more acceptable in informal settings

3.description: Highly offensive and inappropriate in most contexts
3.cultural_notes: Clearly offensive across all German-speaking regions

4.description: Extremely offensive, potentially illegal, or causing significant harm
4.cultural_notes: Hate speech level, can violate German hate speech laws

germany.tolerance_level: Varies by region, generally moderate for sexual profanity

bavaria.tolerance_level: Religious profanity more offensive due to Catholic culture

legal_considerations.german_law: German hate speech laws (Volksverhetzung) make ethnic and religious slurs potentially illegal
legal_considerations.public_usage: Public usage of hate speech can result in legal consequences
legal_considerations.online_enforcement: German authorities enforce hate speech laws online
legal_considerations.historical_sensitivity: Nazi-related terms carry special legal and cultural weight

compound_word_complexity.productive_system: German morphology allows unlimited compound creation
compound_word_complexity.severity_multiplication: Compounds often more severe than individual components
compound_word_complexity.detection_challenges: Compounds can mask individual offensive components
